description: This pretty Cotswolds village is located in a pleasant spot on the River Coln. There's also a noteworthy Norman Church and an 16th century inn to visit in the settlement. This circular walk takes you around the village, visiting the Old Mill House, the River Coln and the neighbouring village of Quenington. There's nice views of the river and some lovely Cotswolds countryside to enjoy on the way.

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: Head to the New Inn for some post walk refreshment. The 16th-century coaching inn serves quality food and can be found at postcode GL7 5AN for your sat navs.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: Head north west along the river and you can visit Bibury and Arlington Row. These picturesque 14th century stone cottages are one of the most photographed Cotswold scenes. See the video below for a walk to the village. Just to the west there's the villages of Ampney Crucis and Ampney St Peter where you can visit a series of noteworthy ancient churches. To the east there's Eastleach where you can enjoy two noteworthy Norman churches and an ancient stone slab clapper footbridge over the River Leach. It's another picture postcard place known for its numerous historic buildings and a colourful display of daffodils in the spring. Lovely Southrop can also be visited in this area. For more walking ideas in the area see the Cotswolds Walks and the Gloucestershire Walks page.

display_address: Post Office, Salt Way, Coln St. Aldwyns, Coln St Aldwyns, Cotswold, Gloucestershire, England, GL7 5AS, United Kingdom
